page.title: 07FARMING -FIELDS,CROPS PANTON
page.content: {PANTON}is a mainly arable area but there are some grass fields. The largest of these is a 76 acre "rig and furrow" field: this field is remark- able for its size being such ancient grassland and has a central causeway along its length. The main crops grown at{PANTON}are winter and spring barley (for annual feeds and brewing), winter and spring wheat (feed-stuffs and bread making), oil seed rape (for animal feeds and margarine and oil for human consumption). The soil-type is medium loam to heavy clay and the majority of the fields have been under drained in recent years. Many of the fields are 2O-5O acres and most are still bounded by thorn hedgerows. There is however still some destruct- ion of hedges taking place with much disapproval of conservationists and other thoughtful people.s
